intro: Sirmuellera repens, commonly known as the creeping sirmuellera, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, woody fruits. Sirmuellera repens is often found in humid, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies.
